channel.title: Science Friday Audio Podcast
channel.description: Science Friday, as heard on NPR, is a weekly discussion of the latest news in science, technology, health, and the environment hosted by Ira Flatow. Ira interviews scientists, authors, and policymakers, and listeners can call in and ask questions as well. Hear it each week on NPR stations nationwide -- or online!
channel.itunes:author: Science Friday
channel.itunes:subtitle: Science Friday is a discussion of the latest news in science, tech, health, and the environment hosted by Ira Flatow. We interview scientists, authors, and policymakers, and take your questions. Hear it weekly on NPR stations nationwide, or online here!
channel.itunes:summary: Science Friday, as heard on NPR, is a weekly discussion of the latest news in science, technology, health, and the environment hosted by Ira Flatow. Ira interviews scientists, authors, and policymakers, and listeners can call in and ask questions as well. Watch the latest science videos from the Science Friday website.
channel.itunes:keywords: Science Friday, scifri, science technology environment health medicine scientist NPR News public radio ira flatow ira plato faltow

item.title: SciFri 060112 Hour 1: Paralysis Rehab, Ignorance, Muck-Dwelling Microbes, Glowing Millipede
item.description: Paralyzed rats regain their footing, why ignorance is key to scientific discovery, a look at two different microbes and their unusual stories, and glowing millipedes.
item.itunes:author: Science Friday
item.itunes:summary: Paralyzed rats regain their footing, why ignorance is key to scientific discovery, a look at two different microbes and their unusual stories, and glowing millipedes.
item.itunes:subtitle: Paralyzed rats regain their footing, why ignorance is key to scientific discovery, a look at two different microbes and their unusual stories, and glowing millipedes.
item.itunes:keywords: Science Friday, scifri, science technology environment health medicine scientist NPR News public radio ira flatow ira plato faltow

item.title: SciFri 060112 Hour 2: Technology and Health Care, Remembering a Son in Immortal Bird
item.description: Got high blood pressure? There is an app for that! Plus, a father reflects on family life, heartbreaking loss, and how he thinks the medical system failed his son.
item.itunes:author: Science Friday
item.itunes:summary: Got high blood pressure? There is an app for that! Plus, a father reflects on family life, heartbreaking loss, and how he thinks the medical system failed his son.

item.title: SciFri 051112 Hour 1: Hidden Racial Bias and Voting, The Push for a Science Debate
item.description: A new study shows hidden racial attitudes are playing a role in the 2012 presidential vote. Plus, a grassroots group is calling for a presidential debate based on science and technology issues.
